arch:property.oc:show_val: The east wall of Room 3.
Collapse and debris
The architecture of all architectural loci and Loci 10 and 11.
Originally 10.50 m north south-by-23.50 m east west.
East north south wall of Trench 96
Dry dusty soil that becomes more compact as excavation continued filled with stones, giant ashlars and collapsed column drums. The soil is a Munsell Light Reddish Brown 2.5YR 6/4.
Closing Elevation: 891.721 m.

This is the entry to the middle cryptoporticus stylobate wall of the East Colonnade. This wall will then become the vaulting wall for the East Cryptoporticus and it is probably the wall that extends under the arch springer course found in Trench 82 2001. At this point no arch springers were evident in this part of the wall, but at the south end of the wall they will become part of the structure and this is where there is the placement of the groin vault (a vault formed by the intersection of two barrel vaults, producing a vault composed of four compartments) observed by Joseph J. Basile in 2001.
Unknown.
The length of this wall is 4.155 m-by-1.955 m in height, which varies to a 2.82 m height depending on its preservation.
Locus 8 the West north south wall of Room 3.
Earlier deposits of Trench 93 2001 and due to the fact there is no soil color change, Locus 4 can probably be combined with Loci 10 and 11.

Phase VII: Roman mid CE 2nd c. repairs following a more collapse. Building of the Propylaeum Central Staircase from the street to the Great Temple Lower Temenos. Wall K is rebuilt in the west and dismantled in the east. Propylaeum West Room 1 east and west walls and doorway built. Benches installed against the north and south faces of Wall K and beneath the betyl niche in the Propylaeum West. The Roman Street is paved at this time. Reconfiguration of the east Portico wall with three doorways - fitted with iron bars and abutted by north south walls forming Propylaeum East Rooms 1, 2, 3.
The original doorways are modified with the installation of vertical iron bars. Thresholds are built up.
Closing Elevation: 893.557 m in the west, 894.585 m in the east. There is a 0.13 m difference between the northwest and southeast of Trench 95 in closing.
Locus 4 covers the east west extent of the trench.
Opening elevation: 894.721 m in the west, 894.814 m in the north, and 894.982 m in the east.
The Portico Wall in the north and Locus 3 the East Pier of Doorway #3.
VII
None.
the rubble from Trench 93 2002.

Opening elevation: 894.55 m at its highest point.
